Episodes.Title: Dude Ranch
Episodes.Plot: While vacationing on Lost Creek Ranch, the three families try their hands at a little cattle herding, skeet shooting and horseback riding. There are also some big firsts, a huge surprise and an actual face-off between Jay and a cowboy named Hank.
Episodes.ParentalRatingReason: PG Coarse language and sexual references
Episodes.Writer: Paul Corrigan, Brad Walsh, Dan O'Shannon
Episodes.GuestStars: Reid Ewing, Tim Blake Nelson, Matthew Gumley

Episodes.Title: When Good Kids Go Bad
Episodes.Plot: Lily has problems with Mitchell and Cameron's plans to adopt another child, Jay tries to get Manny to confess to stealing a locket at school, and Claire goes to extreme lengths to prove that she was right in an argument.
Episodes.ParentalRatingReason: PG Coarse language and sexual references
Episodes.GuestStars: Laurel Coppock, Annie Tedesco, Amanda Musso

Episodes.Title: Phil on Wire
Episodes.Plot: Jay's relationship with the dog irritates Gloria. Phil and Luke try to master the tightrope. Cameron starts a juice fast.
Episodes.ParentalRatingReason: PG Coarse language and sexual references

Episodes.Title: Door to Door
Episodes.Plot: Jay helps Manny with a school fundraiser. Claire petitions for a stop sign at a busy intersection. Phil and Luke try to create a viral video. Gloria searches for Stella.
Episodes.ParentalRatingReason: PG Coarse language and sexual references

Episodes.Title: Hit and Run
Episodes.Plot: Gloria tries to help Jay and Manny with their problems but both are unreceptive. Claire considers running against Councilman Duane Bailey. Cam and Mitch are the victims of a hit-and-run accident.
Episodes.ParentalRatingReason: PG Coarse language and sexual references

Episodes.Title: Go Bullfrogs!
Episodes.Plot: Phil takes Haley to visit his alma mater. Claire goes out with Mitchell and Cameron. Gloria and Jay may have to broach a delicate subject with Manny.
Episodes.ParentalRatingReason: PG Coarse language and sexual references

Episodes.Title: Treehouse
Episodes.Plot: Gloria persuades Jay to commit to a night of salsa dancing after seeing how much his friend Shorty and his girlfriend do together. Cameron makes a bet that he can get a woman's phone number at the bar. Phil builds a tree house for Luke.
Episodes.ParentalRatingReason: PG Coarse language and sexual references

Episodes.Title: After the Fire
Episodes.Plot: The Pritchetts rally for a good cause after a neighbor's house burns down, but there's a downside when Jay throws out his back, Cameron takes on a moving truck, and some donated toys fall into the wrong hands.
Episodes.ParentalRatingReason: PG Coarse language and sexual references

Episodes.Title: Punkin Chunkin
Episodes.Plot: An old neighborhood kid returning to town as a internet billionaire gets Phil thinking of what could have been. Jay feels Manny could use some constructive criticism, Cameron is offended when Mitchell questions the authenticity of his colorful childhood stories.
Episodes.ParentalRatingReason: PG Coarse language and sexual references

Episodes.Title: Express Christmas
Episodes.Plot: The family puts together a quick Christmas celebration when they realize they won't be together on the actual day.
Episodes.ParentalRatingReason: PG Coarse language and sexual references

Episodes.Title: Lifetime Supply
Episodes.Plot: Phil contemplates the worst after missing a call from the doctor. Javier, Manny's biological father, pays another visit to take his son to the horse races, Mitchell wins an environmental law award, creating a competition between Cam and himself on who has the better trophy. Gloria tutors Haley in Spanish.

Episodes.Title: Egg Drop
Episodes.Plot: Jay and Claire take control of their kids' school projects from Manny and Luke, while Haley and Gloria help Phil with a real estate presentation. Cam and Mitchell meet with a potential birth mother.

Episodes.Title: Little Bo Bleep
Episodes.Plot: Claire prepares for her debate with Duane Bailey. Mitch and Cam try to clean up Lily's language before her turn as a flower girl. Jay blames Stella's strange behavior on Gloria.

Episodes.Title: Me? Jealous?
Episodes.Plot: Phil's preoccupation with a business opportunity blinds him to his new partner's inappropriate behavior around Claire. Jay and Gloria may regret letting Mitchell and Cameron be their temporary house guests when their home is being fumigated.

Episodes.Title: Aunt Mommy
Episodes.Plot: Phil and Claire go overboard with drinks, and divulging personal information, on a night out to celebrate the sale of a house to Mitchell and Cameron's friends.

Episodes.Title: Virgin Territory
Episodes.Plot: It's a day of disturbing realizations when Mitchell manages to ruin one of Jay's proudest golf moments, Phil overhears something that may forever change how he sees his little girl, and Gloria stumbles upon Claire's dangerous little secret.

Episodes.Title: Leap Day
Episodes.Plot: Mitchell feels pressured to make Cameron's birthday extra special. People start to question Jay's manliness, and the girls interfere with Phil's leap day plans.

Episodes.Title: Send Out the Clowns
Episodes.Plot: Cameron is reunited with his estranged ex-clown partner, Lewis. Phil is serious about landing a very important listing, only to be trumped by a notorious bulldozer of an agent, Mitzi Roth. Manny has a cool new friend, which makes both Jay and Gloria suspicious.
Episodes.Writer: Steven Levitan, Jeffrey Richman, Bill Wrubel

Episodes.Title: Election Day
Episodes.Plot: Claire's race for town council comes to a head on Election Day as the Dunphys make phone calls for votes and Mitchell and Cameron take to the streets to campaign, while the candidate endures technical problems during some last-minute interviews.

Episodes.Title: The Last Walt
Episodes.Plot: A visit from Cameron's father features an awkward dinner for Jay and Gloria at Mitchell and Cameron's house. Claire helps Luke face the death of an older neighbor, Phil and Alex have a father-daughter bonding experience. Haley throws a party without permission.
Episodes.Writer: Dan O'Shannon, Paul Corrigan, Brad Walsh

Episodes.Title: Planes, Trains and Cars
Episodes.Plot: Phil buys a car without consulting Claire. Jay is on a mission to get to his high-school reunion with Gloria and Manny. Lily loses her favorite toy on a train.

Episodes.Title: Disneyland
Episodes.Plot: When the family travels to Disneyland, Phil struggles to keep up with Luke, Claire is shocked when they run into Dylan, Jay and Gloria disagree about what are sensible shoes for the day, and Mitch and Cam must contain Lily's new affinity for running.

Episodes.Title: Tableau Vivant
Episodes.Plot: Gloria and Jay bicker while trying to order lunch at a diner. Claire and Cam have different theories on how to discipline kids. Luke accepts an award under false pretenses. Phil has a hard time firing Mitchell from his temporary job at the real estate agency. The entire family participates in Alex's living art display of Norman Rockwell's Thanksgiving painting.
Episodes.Writer: Elaine Ko, Jeffrey Richman, Bill Wrubel

Episodes.Title: Baby on Board
Episodes.Plot: Gloria's bilingualism comes in handy on Mitchell and Cameron's quest to adopt another child. Meanwhile, Jay and Manny help Lily get ready for a dance recital. Alex goes to her first prom, and Haley announces her future plans, which come as a shock to her family.
